description.narrative: Community-based mechanisms and processes are established and strengthened to ensure that girls and boys, including youth are protected from abuse, violence, exploitation and neglect, which contributes to Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved access to justice, social services and a minimum package of preventive and protective processes for Somali children, realized through a functional child protection system linked with comprehensive community based child protection mechanisms

description.narrative: UNICEF continues to contribute towards social norms change in Somalia through the communities care programme. The project works through Community Based Child Protection (CBCP) structures to end harmful social norms such as Female Genital Mutilation (FGM) and child marriage. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2017
